_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Devonian Resources, Inc. operates a natural gas compressor and liquid extraction station in Van, Pennsylvania.



A.   Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies 

Devonian Resources, Inc. recognizes management's responsibility in protecting the public, its employees, equipment, property, and the environment.  The safety and health of all personnel are very important.  The control of accidents has been and will continue to be a basic responsibility of all personnel at the Van facility.



To accomplish the company's goal in controlling accidental losses, the facility has a Safety Program in place.  The objectives of the Safety Program are to: maximize efficiency and safety performance, reduce losses associated with damage of property, eliminate human suffering and the economic burden resulting from injuries and accidents.



One of the activities associated with the Safety Program has been the development and implementation of accidental release prevention and emergency response programs which are designed to comply with OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals, 29 CFR 1910.119), and EPA's Risk Management Program (RM program) regulation (Risk Management Programs for Chemical Accidental Release Prevention, 40 CFR Part 68).



The purpose of the accidental release prevention and emergency response programs is to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences of significant releases of flammable substances as well as fires, explosions, and other types of catastrophic accidents.  Overall, these programs prevent accidental fatalities, injuries and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.



The accidental release prevention and emergency response programs help prevent accidents because they focus on the rules, procedures, and practices which govern individual processes, activities, or pieces of equipment.  These rules are detailed and improved as necessary.  They are also commu

nicated to and accepted by all employees at the facility.



 B.   Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program 



The prevention program consists of the following elements:



!    Employee Participation:  This program involves the employees in establishing and implementing the program.  Employees are also to be involved when a process hazard analysis is conducted.  The program also ensures that all employees have complete access to the program.



!    Process Safety Information: Written information has been collected which enables the employees to identify and understand the potential hazards in the system. The written information includes MSDSs and a description of the design of the Van Compressor Station.



!    Process Hazard Analysis: Formal studies using the HAZOP technique have been conducted to look at the system and identify potential hazards.



!    Operating Procedures:  Written, detailed procedures have been developed which describe the steps which should be followed to safely operate the Van Compressor Station.



!    Training: A training program has been developed which ensures that employees are trained on all aspects of the system and on the duties which they should perform to ensure the safe operation of the Van Compressor Station.



!    Contractors: All contractors are screened and evaluated before they perform work on or near the Van Compressor Station.  The contractors are also periodically evaluated to ensure that they perform work by following safe work practices.



!    Pre-Startup Safety Review: A pre-startup safety review is completed for all new projects to verify that all safety programs are in place, training has been performed, and construction has been completed according to design standards before the project is put into use.



!    Mechanical Integrity:  This program ensures that the Van Compressor Station are built and maintained using preventive maintenance procedures to minimize unexpected breakdowns or failures.



!    Hot Work Permit

: These procedures ensure that a signed permit is obtained prior to any cutting, welding, or burning.



!    Management of Change: The procedures are designed to ensure that all changes made to the Van Compressor Station are properly reviewed.



!    Incident Investigation: The procedures ensure that any incidents (and near misses) are investigated, reviewed, and documented using an investigation team.



!    Compliance Audits: There are procedures to conduct regular audits of the RMP program to ensure that the program is in place and working properly.



C.   Five-Year Accident History 



There have been no incidents identified for the Devonian Resources, Inc. Van facility within the last five years that have resulted in any onsite or offsite impacts.





D.   Description of the Emergency Action Program 



An emergency action program has been implemented at the Van facility.  This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.  The program has been coordinated with the Seneca Volunteer Fire Department.



The emergency action program consists of the following elements:

!        Organization Plan and Responsibilities

!        Communications Procedures

!        Detailed Action Plans

!        Emergency Medical Treatment Procedures

!        Evacuation Plans

!        Description of Outside Assistance Available

!        Site Re-Entry Procedures

!        Training Programs and Drills





 

E.   Planned Changes/Efforts to Improve Safety 



!    Continued mechanical integrity inspections

!    Review and implementation of the 2014 process hazard analysis recommendations
